keyword: how many calories is in 1 scrambled egg
title: How Many Calories in 1 Scrambled Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in 1 scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Scrambled Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled with 1 tsp butter or oil; no added salt or milk.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled egg provides ~91 kcal and ~6.5 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories is in 1 scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.5 g protein per scrambled egg.
Very low, about 0.4 g carbs per egg.

faqs.q: How does added butter affect scrambled egg calories?
faqs.a: Adds ~40 kcal; plain scrambled is lower at ~51 kcal.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Yes, ~215 mg per egg, mostly from the yolk.
